name: Altar
blurb: Sacrificial center implying need for purity; background to holiness/defilement diagnosis.
searchText: altar entity cultic sacrificial center implying need for purity; background to holiness/defilement diagnosis.

name: Elders/Heads of fathers’ houses
blurb: Local leaders coordinating work and consent; continuity with Ezra’s narrative.
searchText: elders/heads of fathers’ houses person community-leadership local leaders coordinating work and consent; continuity with ezra’s narrative.

name: Cyrus king of Persia (edict)
blurb: Gentile monarch stirred by God to rebuild the house—history bends toward restoration; the sentence opens into Ezra.
searchText: cyrus king of persia (edict) title narrative gentile monarch stirred by god to rebuild the house—history bends toward restoration; the sentence opens into ezra.

name: Alongside Haggai (Ezra 5–6 link)
blurb: Prophetic tandem credited with advancing temple completion under Persian decrees.
searchText: alongside haggai (ezra 5–6 link) entity historical-link prophetic tandem credited with advancing temple completion under persian decrees.

name: Adversaries of Judah offer ‘help’ and then oppose
blurb: Syncretistic neighbors seek leverage; refusal triggers long harassment—purity of worship resists expedient alliances.
searchText: adversaries of judah offer ‘help’ and then oppose group ethics syncretistic neighbors seek leverage; refusal triggers long harassment—purity of worship resists expedient alliances.

name: Disqualified priestly families (Hobaiah, Hakkoz, Barzillai)
blurb: Excluded from priestly service pending a priest with Urim and Thummim—genealogical caution protects holiness even amid zeal.
searchText: disqualified priestly families (hobaiah, hakkoz, barzillai) group worship excluded from priestly service pending a priest with urim and thummim—genealogical caution protects holiness even amid zeal.

name: Gatekeepers: sons of Shallum, Ater, Talmon, Akkub, Hatita, Shobai
blurb: Gatekeepers restored as part of the temple ecosystem. Counted 139; their presence frames the rebuilt altar and later dedication with ordered praise.
searchText: gatekeepers: sons of shallum, ater, talmon, akkub, hatita, shobai group worship gatekeepers restored as part of the temple ecosystem. counted 139; their presence frames the rebuilt altar and later dedication with ordered praise.

name: Levi search at Ahava; Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and company
blurb: Ezra pauses for Levites and Nethinim, recruiting servants of the house—reform begins with the right people in the right places.
searchText: levi search at ahava; sherebiah, hashabiah, and company group worship ezra pauses for levites and nethinim, recruiting servants of the house—reform begins with the right people in the right places.

name: Levites: sons of Jeshua and Kadmiel (of Hodaviah)

name: List of priests/Levites/Israel committing the offense
blurb: Naming offenders personalizes repentance—integrity of the priesthood and community guarded for future generations.
searchText: list of priests/levites/israel committing the offense group ethics naming offenders personalizes repentance—integrity of the priesthood and community guarded for future generations.

name: Men of Anathoth
blurb: Enumerated among the first returnees under Zerubbabel; their counted men totaled 128. Family identity stabilizes land claims and synagogue-era communities; numbers witness to costly obedience.

blurb: Nehemiah (not the later governor), Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai (not Esther’s cousin), Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah—heads whose presence authenticates the census.
